intro: Oxytropis niedzweckiana, commonly known as the Polish locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, calcareous soils across Central and Eastern Europe. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis niedzweckiana is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a characteristic species of steppe and rocky habitats.
